Experience Mobile App Search & Indexing - Engineering Manager, Tech Lead, Staff Software Engineer Google July 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Mountain View, CA Manage a team to index, understand, and serve the content in mobile apps. App Indexing for Google Search - Google Developers Edit Social Graph Service - Staff Software Engineer, Tech Lead Google January 2012  –  July 2014  (2 years 7 months) Mountain View, CA - The Social Graph Service provides a unified data model and API over all social graph data at Google. It is the central place for reading/writing membership data of G+ Circles, Hangout, G+ Communities, G+ Events and Google Voice, and reading user profiles. The service is a core component of several Google services including Google Plus, Hangout, and Google Voice. 
- As the Tech Lead of the Social Graph Core team, led a team of 5 engineers to develop the main system in Java on top of Spanner storage and ST index, and managed collaboration with clients to support new products and use cases. 
- Drove the design and implementation of the system for scalability (10+B user membership edges and 1M queries/second across 15 data centers), performance (under 12ms mean latency), consistency and client integration (70+ clients). 
- Personally wrote most of the system's backend serving layer and indexing solution. 
- Drove the migration of the system's storage from Megastore to Spanner, in the process significantly increasing the system's scalability (from 100 writes/seconds to 30+K writes/second) and consistency (full serializability). Completed the migration with zero system down-time or change to clients. 
- Led the launch of Hangout, G+ Communities and G+ Vanity URLs on Social Graph Service. Designed and implemented end-to-end indexing solution on top of ST index to support fast group chat lookup and various sorted views in Hangout client. Optimized the system's serving logic to reduce machine usage by 3X. Then XSL-FO documents are transformed to viewable HTML or PDF documents. 
 
ATA : Air Transport Association.
